forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear. Low around 48, with temperatures rising to around 50 overnight. Northwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. Northwest wind around 8 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the night is tranquil, shrouded in a soft clarity typical of these crisp, late winter evenings. The forecast whispers promises of a sun-drenched day ahead, with temperatures projected to hold steady in the low 60s, inviting warmth to wash over the city. Currently, the air is brisk, hovering around 48 degrees, but a calming northwest breeze hints at the dawn breathing its fresh spirit into the cool night.

As the sun rises, you can expect a cheerful sunlit morn, unmarred by the whimsical tendrils of fog, which tend to cling to the shores. The marine layer, although a familiar companion on many mornings, seems to have retreated. The clarity from Sutro Tower allows for a grand view of the sprawling cityscape, beckoning adventurous souls to explore. One might consider donning layers—a light sweater or jacket in the early hours will bridge the coolness, transitioning into more relaxed attire as the sun takes its position high above, inviting a stroll through the verdant parks or perhaps a cafe pit stop to savor a warm beverage. Today is not just another Tuesday; it’s an opportunity beckoning you to stretch your legs, breathe in the crisp, fresh air, and revel in the serene beauty only San Francisco can offer in this captivating season.
